directions: Mix together sugar, eggs, oil and baby food.
Add flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon and nuts; bake at 350° for 1 hour and 20 minutes.
Make sure cake is completely cooled before frosting it.

proportions: 2 lb. beef brisket, plus extra beef bones (2 to 3)
3 c. fresh or canned tomatoes, cut up
directions: Combine brisket, bones and water in deep pot.
Add onions and tomatoes and bring to boil.
Skim off any foam and reduce heat to low.
Simmer 1 hour uncovered.
Add cabbage, salt, pepper and garlic and cook another hour over low heat.
Stir in lemon juice and sugar; cook 20 minutes longer on low heat.
Taste to correct seasoning.
Remove bones.
Slice meat and serve as a garnish with soup.
Serves 6 to 8.
Melt 1 stick margarine.
Add other proportions and mix well. Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes in an unbaked pie shell.
In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar.
Mix carrots, egg, orange juice and orange peel.
Combine flours, baking powder, cinnamon and salt.
Mix
into oleo mixture to blend thoroughly. Mix in prunes and sunflower seeds.
Drop from tablespoon onto greased baking sheets and flatten slightly.
Bake in 375° oven for 15 to 20 minutes until lightly browned.
Cool on rack.
Dust with powdered sugar.
Yields 3 dozen.
Brown ground beef, onions and pepper in skillet.
When tender, mix all other proportions in casserole dish.
Sprinkle cheese over top and bake 30 minutes in oven at 350°.
Brown hamburger in pan and drain grease.
Add taco sauce, enchilada sauce and green chilies; let simmer.
Grate cheese and chop onion.
Put hamburger mixture, cheese and onion inside each corn tortilla (frozen type).
Put in 13 x 9 1/2-inch cake pan.
Put a layer of hamburger mixture on bottom, then add cheese and onion on top.
Bake in oven at 425° until cheese melts, about 10 minutes.
Cook macaroni according to directions on label.
Saute ground beef until well done.
Add tomatoes, green peppers, steak sauce and ketchup.
Simmer for 30 minutes.
Pour into baking dish.
Add cooked macaroni and mushroom soup.
Top with grated cheese.
Mix corn, egg and flour together. Put in a baking pan. Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.
Drain cooked macaroni.
Melt margarine in pan and add onion. Cook until golden brown.
Remove from heat and add macaroni and remaining proportions.
Mix well.
Pour into casserole dish and bake 40 to 45 minutes at 350°.
Drain beans. Form bundles by placing 10 beans on a piece of bacon, wrapping bacon around beans.

proportions: 1 (16 oz.) can crushed pineapple with juice
directions: Mix all proportions and refrigerate.
Quick and easy!

proportions: 1 can Ro-Tel diced tomatoes with juice
directions: Cook tomatoes, onion and peppers until most of liquid is gone. Add finely cut cheese.
Melt over low heat, stirring and observing as this burns easily.
Place dip in chafing dish to keep warm.

proportions: 1 pkg. Winter mix broccoli and cauliflower (16 oz) or use fresh vegetables
directions: Cook just to heat the broccoli and cauliflower then drain and put into casserole dish.
Spread over the vegetable the mushroom soup.

proportions: 2 (6 1/2 oz.) cans tuna, drained and flaked
1 1/2 c. (4 oz.) medium shell macaroni, cooked and drained
1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen peas, thawed and drained
6 bacon slices, crisply cooked and crumbled
directions: Combine dressing, green onions and mustard; set aside.
Toss tuna with dill.
In a 3-quart serving bowl, layer lettuce, shells, cucumber, tomatoes, tuna, peas and bacon.
Spread dressing mixture over bacon, sealing to edge of bowl.
Sprinkle with cheese; cover. Chill several hours or overnight.
Toss to serve.
Makes 8 servings.
Prep. Time: 25 minutes plus chilling.

proportions: 1 (10 oz.) pkg. chopped broccoli, thawed and drained
directions: Heat oven to 425°.
Place cookie sheet in oven to preheat. In a medium saucepan, combine oleo, flour and pepper.
Cook over low heat until mixture becomes thick and bubbly.
Gradually stir in broth and milk and stir until mixture begins to thicken.
Add cheese and stir until melted.
Stir in chicken and broccoli.
Pour mixture into pie shell.
Remove second crust (frozen); place on top of filled pie.
Let thaw 10 to 20 minutes.
Crimp edges together.
Cut slits in top crust.
Place pie on cookie sheet. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until crust is brown.
Preheat oven to 350°.
Grease and flour sheet cake pan (9 x 13-inch).
Sprinkle nuts and coconut in pan.
Spread to cover. Mix cake according to package directions.
Pour evenly over nuts and coconut, but do not stir.
Melt margarine and cream cheese in pan over low heat.
When melted, mix in a box of powdered sugar. Spoon this over cake.
Mix to cover but do not stir.
When cooked, the cake will crack like the earth and is so good!

proportions: 1 (16 oz.) carton small curd cottage cheese
green onion slices, pimentos and red pepper
directions: Stir together the dry proportions.
Add the remaining proportions; mix well.
Pour into greased 7 x 11-inch baking dish. Bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes, until set.
Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
Serves 6.
Put all proportions in bowl and mix well.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. When done, poke holes on top and pour a mixture of pineapple juice and powdered sugar over hot cake.
Place bagel halves on baking sheet.
Top with remaining proportions.
Broil until cheese melts.
Heat oven to 350° and melt margarine in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan. In a saucepan, heat sugar and water until sugar melts.
Cut shortening into flour until particles are fine crumbs.
Add milk and stir.
Turn onto floured board and knead until smooth.
Roll dough into large rectangle; spread apples and sprinkle with cinnamon.
Roll up and slice into 1 1/2-inches and lay apple, side up carefully in pan.
Pour sugar syrup carefully around rolls. Bake 55 to 60 minutes.
Mix food coloring in water and add to cornstarch.
Add less water for thicker solution.
Add more water for a thiningredients one.
Combine all proportions and put in 1-quart airtight contaiingredients. Label and store in cool dry place.
Use within 6 months.
Makes about 3 1/2 cups of mix.
Cook and drain broccoli as directed on package.
Stir and mix butter, eggs, cheese, mayonnaise, onions, soup and broccoli. Place in long baking dish.
Cover with crushed crackers. Bake for 20 minutes at 400°.
Mix butter and graham cracker crumbs together.
Press into 9 x 13-inch pan.
Layer other proportions as listed.
Sprinkle a few nuts on top.
Bake in greased pan at 375° for 30 minutes.
In a bowl, mix oleomargarine, sugar and cocoa.
Add 3 eggs while mixing.
Slowly add flour, baking powder, salt, soda and cinnamon.
Beat in 1/2 cup milk.
Stir in zucchini, nuts and vanilla; mix well.
Pour into a greased and floured 9 x 12-inch cake pan.
Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.
Soften yeast in warm water.
Combine rye flour, molasses, shortening, salt and boiling water; blending well.
Cool to lukewarm; add softened yeast.
Stir in white flour gradually. Transfer to floured board, let rest 10 minutes.
Knead until shiny (about 10 minutes).
Cover and put in greased bowl to rise for 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 400° to 450°.
Wash and pat dry salmon steaks. Place on sheet of foil.
Cut apple into thick slices and place on top of salmon.
Sprinkle with nutmeg (to taste) and wrap foil over. Place in oven (can put cookie sheet under foil or in shallow baking dish).
Bake 15 to 25 minutes, covered, then unwrap and continue baking 5 to 10 minutes longer at lowered temperature of 350°, until salmon pulls into flakes with fork.
Brown bacon, pepper and onion in skillet.
Drain grease and break up bacon.
Add beans, catsup and syrup to skillet.
Let simmer 45 minutes.

proportions: 3 (8 oz.) contaiingredientss Cool Whip topping (or two 12 oz.)
directions: Combine pineapple, condensed milk and lemon juice.
Stir until thickened.
Fold in Cool Whip and nuts.
Divide into 3 graham crusts, chill and pig out.
Melt bark.
Mil all together in pan.
Drop by spoonfuls on wax paper and let cool.

proportions: 1 (8 oz.) pkg. Philadelphia Brand cream cheese, cubed
1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen mixed vegetables, cooked and drained
directions: Heat cream cheese and milk over low heat; stir until smooth. Add mixed vegetables and seasonings; mix well.
Pour into 1-quart casserole.
Cover with potatoes and top with tomato slices.
Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.
Makes 4 servings.
Break up pretzels with hands (enough to cover the bottom of 9 x 13-inch baking dish).
Put butter on top.
Put in 300° oven until butter melts and is absorbed by pretzels.
Sift flour and measure; add baking powder, cocoa and salt. Sift again.
Beat in half the sugar a little at a time.
Beat until smooth and glossy.
Beat egg yolks until thick and lemon-colored; add remaining sugar and vanilla.
Continue beating until very thick; slowly add water, stirring constantly.
Gently fold in beaten whites; gradually fold in dry proportions.
Turn into shallow oblong pan about 15 1/2 x 10 1/2 x 1-inch.
Line with wax paper.
Bake at 375° for 15 to 20 minutes.
Turn out on clean towel and roll up.
Cool.
Melt butter and cocoa together; add sugar, flour, salt, eggs, vanilla and milk.
Mix all together.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
Can add walnuts or other nuts to mix if you like.
Preheat oven to 350°.
In lightly greased casserole dish, place drained pineapple chunks.
In small bowl, mix together sugar and flour and sprinkle over pineapple.
Layer grated cheese over, then cracker crumbs.
Pour melted butter over all.
Bake for 30 to 40 minutes.
Layer a 9 x 13-inch pan with one can of the crescent rolls. Brown the ground beef in a skillet.
Drain the beef and place it on top of the crescent rolls.
Spoon the taco sauce onto the beef. Sprinkle the Cheddar cheese over the beef and taco sauce.
Cover all of this with the remaining can of crescent rolls.
Bake at 350° for approximately 15 minutes.
Using your favorite flavor of Jell-O, mix all proportions until dissolved.
Pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan.
Refrigerate until set. Cut into squares.
Preheat oven and Pam spray two 9 x 13-inch casserole pans. Mix all proportions together except oleo and corn flakes.
Pour into casserole pans and top with corn flake crumbs (rough crumbs) and drizzle melted oleo over the tops.
Bake about 45 minutes or until bubbly.
Yields two 9 x 13-inch pans.
Grease Bundt or tube pan.
Mix together 3/4 cup sugar and 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon.
Cut each biscuit in fourths, using scissors to do this.
Shake pieces from one can at a time in the sugar/cinnamon mixture.
Place these into cake pan.
Melt margarine, 3/4 cup sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon together and pour over biscuit pieces in cake pan.
Bake 35 minutes at 350°.
They may be done sooingredients.
Turn out on cake plate.
Break off in bits.
Do not cook in two-piece angel food pan.
All the butter will leak out!
Melt chocolate in microwave, stirring often to avoid scorching.

Add the pretzels and peanuts and stir to coat well. Cover a cookie sheet with foil and spread the mixture on foil. Let cool in refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or until hardened. Lift foil from cookie sheet and peel away from hardened candy. Break candy into bite-sized pieces. Store in air-tight contaiingredients in a cool, dry place.

proportions: 1 lb. can salmon, flaked, remove bone and dark meat
directions: Combine cheese, juice, onion and seasoning.
Then add salmon. Chill 2 hours.
Shape mixture into ball.
Roll in nuts and parsley.
Serve with crackers.
Combine sour cream, dill weed and onion in a small bowl, stirring well.
Cover and refrigerate 2 hours.
Cut tomatoes into 1/4-inch slices and place in large bowl.
Fill bowl with ice water and let stand 30 minutes.
Combine flour, cornmeal, salt and pepper.
Drain tomatoes and pat dry with paper towels.
Dip tomato slices in beaten eggs and dredge in flour mixture.
Cook tomatoes in single layer in 1/2-inch oil over high heat until lightly browned, turning once.
Drain on paper towels and serve with sauce.

proportions: 1 (2 lb.) bag frozen hash brown potatoes
directions: Spread potatoes on bottom of 9 x 13-inch greased pan.
Blend together all other proportions except cornflakes.
Spread over potatoes.
Spread cornflakes on top.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
Place shredded cabbage in covered dish in refrigerator for several hours. Mix proportions in order given 30 minutes before serving. Chill and serve.
Boil sugar, Karo and water until it spins thread.
Add peanuts and stir continually after peanuts are added. Cook until mixture turns brownish gold. Take from the fire. Add butter, salt and soda.
Pour onto buttered pan to cool.
When hard, break into pieces.

proportions: Spike seasoning or any mixed herbs
directions: Cut chicken into bite size pieces and place in Dutch oven. Shake on herbal seasoning mixture, add mushrooms and pour in 1/2 cup milk.
Layer on cheese.
Cover and bake at 350° for 10 to 15 minutes.

Remove pan from oven and add croutons that have been soaking in beaten egg, milk, bouillon and Parmesan cheese mixture. Distribute croutons evenly to keep in moisture and make a crust. Return to oven without lid.
Bake about 45 minutes or until croutons are nicely browned.

Cream butter and sugar; add eggs. Beat well. Add sour milk. Sift together dry proportions and add to creamed mixture by hand or low speed in mixer until well mixed. Fold in blueberries. Pour batter into 9x9-inch pan, greased and lined with wax paper; bake about 350° for 45-50 minutes.
Mix flour, sugar and salt.
Cut in margarine and stir in 1/2 cup of nuts.
Press into 9 x 13-inch pan.
Bake at 350° for about 15 minutes.
Mix 1 1/4 cups sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Stir in beaten eggs, milk, salt and vanilla.
Fold in cranberries, coconut and the rest of the nuts.
Spread over partly baked crust. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, until top is golden.
Cool in pan 10 minutes on a rack; cut in bars while warm.
Cut Twinkies in half lengthwise; line cake pan.
Bake a yellow cake (follow cake recipe), but add 2 packages of French vanilla (instant as directions says) pudding as a topping (for regular cake size) for cake instead of icing.
Pour over the cake.
Then drain one large can of crushed pineapple and spread all over top of pudding.
Then top pineapples with Cool Whip (1 tub).
Sprinkle with 2 cups of coconut and sprinkle chopped finely chopped pecans as decoration.
Can be frozen.

proportions: 3 to 4 oz. can chopped jalapeno peppers or mild green chilies
directions: Preheat oven to 350°.
In greased 9 x 13-inch pan, place layer of cheeses and layer of peppers.
Pour eggs over top.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until eggs are set.
Cut into appetizer size squares.
Combine sugar and butter in heavy pot.
Bring to a boil and cook for 9 minutes or hard crack stage, stirring constantly.
Pour into 2 well buttered 8-inch pie tins.

proportions: garlic salt, onion salt and pepper to taste
directions: Prepare instant potatoes as directed.
While still warm add sour cream, cream cheese and spices.
Place in deep casserole (can be covered and frozen at this point.) Sprinkle with parsley, if desired.
Bake uncovered 45 minutes to 1 hour until top is lightly brown at 325°.
May take longer if frozen.

proportions: 1 can milk (empty soup and use can to measure milk)
directions: Cook spaghetti noodles as directed.
In frying pan, brown hamburger with onions. Add cream cheese, tomato soup, milk and olives.
Cook until thick and bubbly, then add spaghetti noodles. Put into large glass dish and cook in oven at 400° for 45 minutes.
Cook green beans and garlic powder together.
Bring to a boil; reduce heat to medium and cook 10 to 15 minutes.

proportions: 4 c. cooked macaroni, rinsed and cooled
directions: Combine all proportions.
Chill and serve.
Serves 8 to 10.
Bake in casserole in a 375° oven for 1 hour, until potatoes are tender.
Makes 8 servings.
Cook all except cumin, cayenne and oregano.
Add cumin, cayenne and oregano.
Cold pack 10 to 25 minutes.
Good on taco salad.
Combine flour, baking powder, salt, brown sugar, nonfat dry milk and oats in medium bowl.
Mix thoroughly, breaking up brown sugar to distribute evenly.
Cut in shortening until mixture is crumbly.
Combine eggs and water; add to flour mixture.
Stir just until blended.
Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Bake in 400° oven for 8 to 10 minutes, or until lightly browned. Makes 2 dozen drop biscuits.
Stir flour, baking powder, salt and chives together.
Combine milk, oil and add to dry proportions.
Salt and
pepper
insides
of birds.
Stuff with cooked brown rice.
Baste
with sauce every 15 minutes.	Bake at 375° for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Beat butter, sugars, vanilla and eggs until fluffy.
Process oatmeal in blender until it's like flour; add to butter mixture. Sift flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt; add to mixture. Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop cookies on baking sheet.
Bake at 350° for 7 to 8 minutes.

proportions: 1 c. crushed or chopped fresh strawberries or 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen strawberries, drained
directions: Cream together the butter or margarine, sugar and almond extract.
Beat in egg yolks, one at a time.
Sift together dry proportions.
Add alternately with strawberries to creamed mixture.
Beat egg whites until stiff; fold into mixture.
Line a 9 x 5-inch pan with greased waxed paper.
Turn batter into pan and bake at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes, or until toothpick comes out clean.
Cool 15 minutes on rack, then remove to finish cooling. Freezes well.
Dissolve yeast in warm water; let stand 5 minutes.
Combine yeast mixture with butter and flour in bowl; mix well.
Stir in egg and sugar.
Refrigerate overnight.
Spoon butter into greased muffin pans; fill 2/3 full.
Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.

proportions: 1 (15 1/2 oz.) jar spaghetti sauce with mushrooms
directions: In casserole dish, crumble beef and sausage; add onion and garlic.
Cook, covered, on High for 4 to 6 minutes in microwave. Drain fat.
Stir in sauce, undrained beans, water and pepper. Cook, covered, on High 7 to 9 minutes or until thoroughly heated, stirring once.
Arrange biscuits around outer edges, leaving center open.
Sprinkle the center with cheese and parsley.
Cook, uncovered, on High 2 to 3 minutes or until biscuits are done, turning at 1 1/2 minutes.
Cook first 5 proportions 3 1/2 hours.
Add mushrooms halfway through and cooked ground beef.
Mix all the proportions together.
Bake at 350° for about 30 minutes.

proportions: 1 pkg. Pepperidge Farm corn bread stuffing
directions: Boil chicken until tender.
Cool and debone.
Mix milk, celery soup
and	chicken
soup.	Add
1 cup chicken broth to mixture. Melt
margarine
and
stir into corn bread stuffing. In
a large dish put a layer of crumbs, a layer of chicken and soup mixture. Put another layer of crumbs, a layer of chicken and
soup mixture.
Top
with
crumbs and bake at 350° for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Tear cake into tiny pieces and line bottom of an oblong cake pan.
Mix Cool Whip and almond extract together and pour over cake. Pour pie filling over this and swirl around.
(Can use other pie filling if desired.)
In a 2-quart saucepan, combine butterscotch, chocolate chips and condensed milk.
Heat over medium-low heat, stirring until chips are melted.
Do not let chocolate burn.
Remove from heat. Stir nuts and marshmallows into mixture.
Spread into greased 9-inch square baking pan.
Refrigerate until firm, about 2 hours. Cut into squares.
Makes 2 pounds.
Chop bell pepper and cook in a little oil.
Mix squash, eggs, cheese, bell pepper, salt, butter and 1/2 the bread crumbs.
Pour into baking dish.
Sprinkle with remaining crumbs.
Bake 1 hour at 350° (uncovered).
Serves 6.
Brown all meat together with onions.
Drain.
Add cheese and melt in meat.
Add soup and peppers.
Mix together in saucepan everything except egg yolks.
Beat egg yolks and add to mixture.
Cook over medium heat until thick. Pour in baked pie shells.
Two-pie recipe.
Beat eggs, oil, honey and vanilla until thick and creamy. Stir in zucchini and pineapple.
Add dry proportions, mixing on low speed until just blended.
Stir in nuts and raisins, then pour into two well-greased loaf pans.
Bake 45 to 55 minutes at 350° or until center is done.

proportions: 1/2 c. concentrated white grape juice, simmered down from 1 1/2 c.
directions: Place berries, juices, rind and salt in saucepan.
Mash berries to release juice.
Heat to boiling.
Sprinkle gelatin over hot mixture, stirring well to dissolve.
Remove from heat; skim and pack immediately into hot, sterile jars topped with sterile lids.
Set aside to cool to room temperature.
When cool, freeze in sharp freeze section of freezer.
Remove to main part for storage.
To use, thaw overnight.
One tablespoon has 6 calories.

proportions: 2 small pkg. vanilla instant pudding (you may substitute lemon or chocolate)
2 large Butterfinger candy bars, crushed fine
directions: Combine cracker crumbs and margarine.
Mix well.
Put 2/3 mixture in bottom of greased 9 x 13-inch pan.
Mix pudding and milk.
Blend in ice cream and pour over cracker mixture. Refrigerate until well set.
Spread Cool Whip over pudding.
Mix candy with remaining cracker crumbs and sprinkle over top. Refrigerate.
Noodles: Combine eggs, flour, oil and salt. Add small amounts of water to moisten. Roll thinly on floured surface. Cut into strips and separate to dry.
Mix all together, except flour and milk.
Mix flour and milk until smooth; then mix all together and pour into a greased baking dish.
Bake at 375° approximately 1 1/2 hours or until firm and slightly browned.
Mix together softened cream cheese, mayonnaise and nuts.
Add cream a little at a time to make a smooth texture.
Add sugar.
Put a heaping tablespoon on each pear half; serve on lettuce leaf.

proportions: 2 (8 or 9-inch) pie shells, baked and cooled
directions: Whip cream cheese until soft and fluffy.
Beat in confectioingredientss sugar.
Stir in cranberry sauce; fold in whipped topping.
Divide filling between the 2 pie shells.
Freeze.

proportions: 1 red onion, cut into large chunks
directions: With your hands, mix turkey in a bowl with chopped onion, chopped green pepper, tomato sauce, Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, allspice, salt and pepper.
Form mixture into 8 or 9 oval balls.
Combine all proportions. Shape in little balls. Roll in flour-paprika mixture.
Fry in 3 tablespoons butter until brown. Add spaghetti and sauce.

proportions: 4 Tbsp. fat-free Ranch or Blue cheese dressing
directions: *Note:
Butter can be substituted with fat-free margarine or Blue Bonnet light to cut more fat grams.
Cook macaroni in salted water until tender.
Put in a casserole dish; add milk, cheese, pepper and a dot of butter.
Top the macaroni with bread crumbs and bake for about 30 minutes at 325° or until it is browned.
May also add chopped peppers, onions, celery or parsley.
Melt butter, peanut butter and chocolate chips. Pour in box of Rice Chex, then put Rice Chex in bag of powdered sugar.
Drain beans and peas.
Add all other proportions.
Mix well. Cover and chill.

proportions: 1/4 c. each water and soy sauce
directions: While rice is cooking, cut steak into 1/4-inch strips. Sprinkle meat with paprika and allow to stand while preparing other proportions.
Mix dry proportions first in a large bowl.
Then mix in the rest of the proportions.
Spray loaf pans with Pam.
Makes 4 large loaves or 6 to 7 small.
Bake in a 350° oven for 35 to 40 minutes.
Cut apples in 1/4-inch slices and place in a buttered baking dish.
Add cinnamon and water.
Work together the sugar, flour and butter until crumbly.
Spread over apples and bake at 350° uncovered for about 40 minutes.
Serve hot with whipped cream.
Cream butter, sugar, flour, vanilla and nutmeg.
Add eggs and buttermilk, stirring until mixed.
Put in dash of salt, if desired.
Pour in unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
Fry and crumble sausage.
Spread cream cheese onto pizza pan. Cover with salsa followed by sausage, onion, green pepper and cheese.
Scoop up onto tortilla chips to serve.
Put first 5 proportions into a large brown sack and shake well.
Add oil and shake until well mixed and coated.
Put in airtight contaiingredients for at least 1 hour

proportions: 1 (10 oz.) frozen chopped spinach, cooked and wrung dry
directions: Brown together beef and onion; drain fat.
Add garlic powder, salt, oregano, basil, brown sugar, green pepper, tomatoes, water, tomato sauce and tomato paste.
Simmer for 1 hour or until condensed.
Blend dry proportions to cream and mix thoroughly.
Add 1 cup nuts (pecans or walnuts), 1 cup chopped dates and 1/2 cup cherries.

proportions: 2 c. cut-up fully cooked smoked ham
1 c. shredded natural Swiss cheese (about 4 oz.)
1/3 c. chopped green onions or chopped onion
directions: The pie that does the impossible by making its own crust. Makes 6 servings.
Cut potatoes in wedges; roll in flour, then pour in oil in fry skillet.
Place potatoes in oil and cook until brown.
Place on paper towel to drain excess oil.
Dice lettuce and tomatoes. Place on plate, then add potatoes on top.
Heat cheese in microwave oven, then pour over top of all your proportions. Serves 4.
Mix all proportions in greased casserole dish.
Bake 1 hour at 325°.
Cream butter, sugar and egg yolks.
Cream and mash potatoes and mix.
Add milk.
Sift dry proportions.
Add nuts and raisins. Beat egg whites.
Fold in last and bake in 350° oven until done. May cover with chocolate icing or any other favorite icing.
(May use 1/4 cup cocoa in cake for chocolate flavor, if desired.)
Mix flour, salt and pepper in bowl.
Coat chicken in flour mixture and cook in oil until brown.
Remove drippings from pan. Return chicken to pan.
In a bowl mix peach preserves, barbecue sauce, soy sauce and onion; mix well.
Cover chicken with sauce and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and cook 40 minutes.
Add water chestnuts, green pepper slices and carrot slices.
Cook an additional 10 minutes.
Serve over rice.
Blend cake mix, butter and egg together.
Press into a 9 X 13 greased pan.
Cream together the cream cheese and powdered sugar. Add eggs and mix until smooth.
Pour over crust.
Bake at 350 degrees for 35 to 40 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool completely before cutting.

proportions: 8 sweet potatoes, pared and cut up
directions: Boil sweet potatoes for 30 minutes or until tender.
Mash. Add remaining proportions, except marshmallows and pecans.
Spoon mixture into greased casserole, cover with marshmallows and sprinkle with pecan halves.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
Serve immediately.
Add sugar to cooled, melted oleo and eggs, one at a time.
Add dry proportions all at once; mix thoroughly.
Add vanilla, chocolate chips and nuts.
Bake at 350° for 25 minutes in a 13 x 9-inch pan.
You must take out of oven before they are finished. It takes 15 minutes, but the middle is all soft.
If left in oven too long, they will be too hard.
Mix sugar and cornstarch.
Add water gradually, stirring constantly.
Boil for 5 minutes.
Remove from fire and add butter, lemon juice and nutmeg.
This is great over bread pudding.

proportions: 1 to 2 c. leftover meat (barbecue chicken, pork chops, ham, etc.)
directions: Heat wok or large frying pan on high.
Add oil, then chopped green onions, including most of green parts.
Stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add leftover meat that has been cubed; stir-fry another minute.
Add cooked mixed vegetables; season to taste with garlic powder and ginger.
Stir-fry 1 minute more, then add rice and mix well.
Add scrambled eggs which have been mashed well with a fork. Sprinkle with soy sauce to taste; stir-fry for 2 more minutes. Enjoy.

proportions: 1 pkg. Uncle Ben's wild rice mix
directions: Cook mushrooms in butter about 4 minutes.
Cook rice according to directions on box.
Mix all proportions in buttered 2-quart casserole.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
Makes 8 servings.

proportions: 1 (4 oz.) bar German sweet chocolate, shaved
directions: Mix dry proportions; whip eggs and oil together and add remaining proportions and stir to mix well.
Pour into a greased and floured 9 x 13-inch pan and bake at 350° for 40 minutes.

proportions: 2 c. (1 lb. can) drained, canned salmon
directions: In bowl, combine all proportions, except parsley.
Mix well. Refrigerate about 4 hours or until firm enough to shape into a ball.
Shape in ball; roll in parsley (and chopped nuts, if desired).
Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.
Serve with crackers or small slices of rye bread.
Makes 5-inch ball.

proportions: any seasoning to match your taste
directions: Cook patties until done; drain grease.
Simmer sauce, then mix cheeses, sauce, patties, garlic and herbs.
Cook for 20 to 30 minutes.

proportions: 1 (4 oz.) can chopped green chilies, drained
directions: Combine first 6 proportions in a large bowl.
Combine corn meal and remaining proportions; stir into corn mixture.
Pour into a lightly greased 11 x 7 x 1 1/2-inch baking dish.
Bake at 350° for 50 minutes or until a knife inserted in center comes out clean.
Bake unpricked pastry shell in very hot oven (450°) for 5 minutes or until lightly browned.
Remove from oven; reduce temperature to 325°.
Cook bacon until crisp; drain and crumble. Reserve 2 tablespoons.
Place remaining bacon in pie shell.
Add cheese.
Combine remaining proportions and pour over cheese.
Trim with reserved bacon.
Bake at 325° for 35 to 40 minutes or until knife inserted just off-center comes out clean.
Let cool 10 minutes before serving.
Stir together; pour into dessert dishes and cool.
Makes four servings.

proportions: 6 (10 3/4 oz.) cans cream of chicken soup (undiluted)
directions: Place chicken in greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with garlic powder and pepper.
Top each breast with cheese slice; set aside.
Combine soup and milk; stir until smooth.
Pour over chicken.
Sprinkle with stuffing mix and drizzle with butter.
Bake at 350° for 50 minutes.
Mix together the Miracle Whip, Sweet 'N Low and vinegar.
Pour over chopped vegetables.
Add bacon bits and cheese.
Best if chilled a couple of hours before serving.
Cube steak and brown; drain.
In large pot, boil about 4 cups water, bouillon, onion, pepper and mushrooms for 20 minutes.
Add meat.
Boil rice; add to mixture.
Add soy sauce.
Cook for about 10 minutes.
Mix and heat proportions and add crab meat at the end.
Mix Jell-O and water regular way.
Add nuts, celery, cranberries, apple and sour cream.
Chill until ready.
Mix graham crackers and melted butter.
Put in a 13 x 9-inch pan.
Mix all other proportions, except the cherries.
Add on top of the pie crust.
When done pouring the mixture, smooth evenly and top with the cherries; refrigerate.
Combine all proportions and cook on medium until it boils, then cook on low for 3 to 4 hours.
Add water if necessary to desired thickness.
Brush 6 tortillas with water and place on an ungreased baking sheet.
Spread 2/3 cup of cheese over each tortilla.
Sprinkle with some diced olives and chilies.
Top each with another tortilla.
Brush tortilla lightly with water.
Cover baking sheets with foil.
Bake at 300° for 15 minutes or until hot and cheese is completely melted.
Remove from oven and cut each tortilla into 6 wedges.
Top each wedge with an avocado slice and brush with lemon juice.
Add hot sauce, if desired.
Yields 24.

In skillet, cook beef and onion until tender. Drain. Stir in flour, salt and pepper until blended. Add pizza sauce and corn. Simmer 5 minutes. Transfer to a greased 13 x 9 baking dish. Separate biscuits and arrange over beef mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 20 minutes or until biscuits are golden and cheese is melted. Makes 6 servings.

proportions: 2 (3 lb.) chickens, cut up or 16 chicken pieces (your favorite)
directions: Combine dry proportions in a plastic bag.
In a bowl, lightly beaten eggs and milk.
Dip chicken pieces in egg mixture and shake off excess.
Shake a few pieces in the bag at a time, coating well.
In an electric skillet, heat 1/4-inch oil to 350°.
Brown chicken on all sides.
Reduce heat to 275° and continue cooking for 30 minutes.
Makes 6 to 8 servings.
Mix vanilla pudding with milk until blended.
Add sour cream and sweetened condensed milk.
Fold in whipped topping.
Prepare pie crust as directed on box for 9-inch pie.
Line plate bottom with crust.
Mix sugar and flour.
Mix with apples. Fill apples in bottom of crust; add the blueberry filling on top of apples.
Cover with top crust.
Slit vent in top; flute edges high to prevent spill-over in oven.
Heat oven to 400°.
Bake 10 minutes.
Reduce to 350° and bake 25 minutes longer.
Makes one 9-inch pie.
Serves 8.
Combine first 3 proportions in medium pan; stir well.
Add remaining proportions; cook over low heat, stirring constantly until thickened.
Serve warm over pork or ham.
In a large bowl, soften and cream Genesis 18.
Slowly beat in Isaiah.
In small bowl, beat Job well and add to creamed mixture. Sift together 1 Samuel, 1 Kings, Exodus and Luke.
Add to creamed mixture and mix thoroughly.
Fold in 2 Samuel and Genesis 43. Grease a 9-inch tube pan with Judges.
Line with waxed paper; pour in batter.
Bake 30 minutes at 350°.
Lower oven temperature to 325° and bake 20 to 25 minutes longer until cake is golden brown and tests done.
Cool in pan on wire rack 15 minutes.
Invert onto serving plate, remove waxed paper and cool completely.
Add flour to water a little at a time.
Cook until real thick; let cool.
Mix sugar and shortening together until creamy.
Add flour mixture a little at a time.
Beat until smooth and creamy. Frosting will not get hard.

proportions: 1 (15 oz.) can unsweetened pineapple chunks, undrained
directions: Place chicken in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish.
Combine Worcestershire sauce and next 3 proportions; stir well.
Pour over chicken.
Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
Cut chicken breasts in half.
Thaw frozen artichoke hearts and green beans.

proportions: 1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup (undiluted)
1 Tbsp. fresh dill, chopped or 1 tsp. dill weed
directions: Dip pieces of chicken in melted margarine, then roll pieces in crushed Rice Krispies.
Season to taste.
Place in pan lined with aluminum foil.
Bake for 1 hour at 350°.
Melt margarine, sugar and vanilla in microwave oven.
Add marshmallows and melt, stirring mixture once or twice during cooking.
Pour over popcorn.
Shape into balls.
Parboil slices in skillet; drain skillet well before using it for frying.
Heat oil in skillet until hot.
Dip salt pork in flour mixture; put in skillet and fry until golden brown.
To thicken gravy, use 2 tablespoons of flour used for dredging. Blend the flour and fat very well before adding milk.
Mix all proportions together and store in refrigerator.
To use, heat a small quantity to room temperature.
Feed kitten with an eye dropper.

proportions: 18 large mushrooms, cleaned, stems removed and chopped (but reserved)
directions: Clean mushrooms and pat dry.
Then rub with oil.
Arrange them in a large 13 x 9-inch pan.
Add water.
Cook sausage until brown; remove to drain.
Reserve drippings to saute onion, garlic and stems.
Mix the sausage, spinach, egg, bread crumbs and Parmesan. Mix well, then stir in onion, garlic and stems.
Simmer onions in butter in heavy pan on low until tender and separated.
Stir constantly.
Place in a 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with pepper; top with cheese.
Heat soup, milk and soy sauce until blended.
Pour soup mixture over all; stir gently. Butter bread slices on both sides and top casserole, overlapping the slices.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
Combine all proportions in a jar.
Cover.
Shake well.
Chill. Cook macaroni.
Drain and cool.
Mix with your favorite vegetables, broccoli, tomatoes, etc. and pour the dressing over and mix and chill.
*I never buy buttermilk.
I add 1 tablespoon vinegar to 1 cup milk and let stand 5 minutes.
Make a large patty for each person.
Place each patty separately in foil.
Sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce over meat; dash with salt and pepper.
Place slice of onion on top of meat.
Place sliced potato on top of onion.
Place sliced carrot around meat.
Sprinkle with all-purpose flour, seasoning and a little more sauce over vegetables.
Wrap tight in foil. Bake 1 1/4 hours at 325°.
Serve hot.

proportions: 6 slices American cheese, each cut into 4 lengthwise strips
directions: Combine dairy sour cream, mayonnaise and mustard.
Lay ham slice flat.
Spread with some of the sour cream mixture.
Lay strip of American cheese on one end of ham slice.
Roll jelly roll fashion.
Fasten with toothpick topped with olive.
Makes 24 rolls.

proportions: 1 (1 lb. 12 oz.) can pork and beans
directions: Fry onion and bacon.
Add remaining proportions. Bake in bean pot at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.
Cook until the berries pop the cranberries, raisins, sugar, water and spices.
Add celery and apple and continue to cook until mixture thickens and apples are cooked.
Makes about one quart.
Cook and drain noodles.
Cook onions and peppers in margarine until tender.
Stir in soup, mushrooms, pimento, milk and basil. Layer half of noodles in a 9 x 13-inch pan.
Top with 1/2 of sauce, 1/2 of cottage cheese, 1/2 of chicken and half of both cheeses. Repeat layers.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
If casserole comes from "fridge" add 15 minutes to baking time.

proportions: 12 oz. fresh Ricotta cheese (1 1/2 c.; I use low-fat)
1/4 c. snipped parsley or 1 to 2 tsp. dried parsley
directions: In a 2-quart saucepan, cook onion and garlic in oil until tender but not browned.
Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, water, sugar, oregano, thyme, the first 1/4 teaspoon salt and bay leaf.
Bring to boiling; simmer, uncovered, for 45 minutes.
Remove bay leaf.
Mix Kool-Aid, sugar and water.
Add pineapple juice and chill. (One package cherry Kool-Aid and one package raspberry Kool-Aid make a good flavor combination.
For green punch, use lemon-lime Kool-Aid.)
Pour over ice in punch bowl.
Add chilled ginger ale. Serve at once.
Makes 50 half cup servings.
Heat oven to 425°.
Grease small baking pan.
Blend all proportions about 20 seconds.
Beat 1 minute.
Pour into pan. Bake 20 to 25 minutes.
Cook ziti with salt.
Cut ham into little squares.
Drain ziti.
Grease a casserole dish.
Then put one layer ziti and one layer of ham into casserole dish.
Melt margarine in medium saucepan over medium heat.
Stir in flour until well blended.
Gradually stir in half and half, water and chicken bouillon cubes.
Cook, stirring constantly until sauce is slightly thickened.
Add sliced mushrooms (drained).
Stir in cheese and heat just until melted. Serve over fettuccine noodles or tortellini.
Put sherbet in punch bowl.
Pour in 7-Up.
Mix well and serve.
Mix all proportions and serve ice cold on a bed of lettuce.

proportions: rice crispies or corn flakes (a hand full)
directions: Melt 1 stick of oleo in a 9 X 13 pan.
Add 2 cups crushed graham crackers on top of oleo.
Continue to layer the following: 1-6 oz package chocolate chips, 1 -6 oz package butterscotch chips, 1 cup shredded coconut, 3/4 cup chopped walnuts, 1 can condensed milk--pour over the top.
Top with rice crispies or crushed corn flakes (a hand full).
Bake at 350° for 20-25 minutes.
Mix all of the proportions and put into a medium sized baking skillet.
Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.
Mix thoroughly making sure sugar is dissolved.
Serve cold. Makes 1 gallon.

proportions: 1 (19.8 or 21.5 oz.) pkg. fudge brownie mix
1 (14 oz.) can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk (not evaporated)
directions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Prepare brownie mix as package directs. Stir in nuts.
Spread into greased 13 x 9-inch baking pan.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until center is set.
In heavy saucepan, over medium heat, melt chips and margarine with sweetened condensed milk and vanilla.
Spread evenly over brownie layer. Cool. Chill 2 hours or until topping is firm.
Cut into bars. Store covered at room temperature.
Makes 24 to 36 bars.

proportions: 3 lb. large shrimp, peeled and deveined
directions: Salt cucumbers; place in bowl for 2 hours.
Wring out moisture.
Mix other proportions together in large bowl.
When cucumbers are ready, add to mixture.
Let it sit for an hour; adjust seasoning.
Serve on bed of lettuce.
Serves 6 to 8.
Wash mushrooms and remove stems.
In a bowl, mix clams and wine.
Cut a few mushroom stems and add 1/3 to 1/2 cup Italian bread crumbs.
Spoon stuffing into mushroom caps.
Place in baking pan and pour 1/4 cup melted butter over them.
Cook in oven 20 minutes at 375°.
Slice steak into narrow strips.
In skillet, brown steak in oil.
Combine with garlic, salt, pepper, soy sauce and sugar in crock-pot.
Cook on low 6 to 8 hours.
Turn control to high.
Add bean sprouts, tomatoes and green peppers.
Dissolve cornstarch in water and stir into pot.
Cover and cook on high 15 to 20 minutes. Serves 4.
Prepare pastry; set aside.
Cook potatoes and carrots until tender in one saucepan.
Cook celery and onions in another pan. While vegetables are cooking, make gravy by adding flour to the butter in a small pan.
When blended, add chicken broth, salt, pepper and poultry seasoning.
Bring to a boil.
Set aside.
Blend eggs slightly.
Add syrup, sugar, salt, margarine and vanilla.
Add nuts.
Pour into unbaked pie shell and bake for 12 minutes in a 375° oven, then reduce heat to 325° and bake for 40 minutes or until pie is set.

proportions: 1 lb. New York State strong cheese
1/8 tsp. or dash of red pepper (1/4 tsp. if doubled)
directions: Grate cheese.
Let butter soften to room temperature.
Hand mix cheese and butter until smooth.
Mix dry proportions together, then pour into cheese and butter mixture.
Mix with hands until well blended.
Press onto cookie sheet (ungreased).
Bake about 15 minutes or until set at 350°.
Makes 7 to 8 dozen.

proportions: 24 crushed Oreo cookies (do not remove filling)
1/2 gal. mint chocolate chip ice cream
directions: Mix crushed Oreo cookies and melted butter; press into 9 x 13-inch cake pan.
Freeze.
Soften 1/2 gallon ice cream.
Spread over frozen crust.
Return to freezer.
In saucepan, melt semi-sweet chocolate; add powdered sugar, butter and evaporated milk.
Bring to rolling boil; cool.
Spread over ice cream. Return to freezer.
Keep frozen until just before serving.
Brown beef in 2 tablespoons butter.
Drain.
Garlic to taste. Add sugar, salt and pepper.
Then add tomato sauce and let simmer on low for 15 minutes.
Boil raisins in 1 3/4 cups water for 5 minutes.
Combine brown sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon and salt.
Moisten with remaining 1/4 cup water.
Add to raisins, stirring until mixture boils.
Remove from heat and add butter and vinegar.
Pour into pastry lined 9-inch pie pan.
Cover with top crust.
Bake 15 minutes at 425°, then reduce heat to 350° and bake until brown.

proportions: 1/4 c. firmly packed light brown sugar
1/2 c. dry cranberries or cherries, coarsely chopped
1/2 c. chilled butter, cut into pieces (1 stick)
directions: Preheat oven to 400°.
Butter 2 large cookie sheets.
Sift flour into bowl.
Mix in both sugars.
Add butter and rub in fingertips until mixture resembles coarse meal.
Add 1/2 cup dried fruit.
Stir in enough cream to form soft, slightly sticky dough. Turn dough out onto slightly floured surface and knead until just combined.
Gather dough into ball; flatten into disc.
Roll out to thickness of 3/4-inch.
Cut out rounds using 2-inch round cookie cutter.
Gather scraps and re-roll on floured surface.
Cut out additional rounds.
Dip chicken in milk and then roll in bread crumbs.
Bake chicken at 375° for 30 minutes.
Pour salsa on top.
Bake for 30 more minutes or until chicken is done.
Mix dry proportions. Add milk, well beaten egg and melted fat. Beat. Bake in a shallow greased pan in a hot oven, 375°, for 20 minutes or more.

proportions: 3 Tbsp. cornstarch, mixed with a little vinegar
directions: Combine tomatoes, salt, sugar, vinegar, cinnamon, mustard, red pepper and mixed spices in kettle.
Boil hard for 1 hour.
Strain. Return to stove and thicken with cornstarch, moistened with a little vinegar.
Boil for 10 minutes.
Very good. I prefer to use only 1 teaspoon red pepper.
Heat oven to 400°.
Grease or line bottoms of 12 muffin cup tin.
Combine first 4 proportions.
Stir in remaining proportions until dry proportions are moistened.
(Batter will be lumpy.) Fill cups 2/3 full.
Bake at 400° for 20 to 25 minutes.
Remove from pan.
Serve warm.

proportions: 1 (16 to 20 oz.) bottle ketchup (plain or tangy)
directions: Place roast and vegetables in a large, heavy pot.
Cover with water.
Cook, covered, for 4 hours. Remove meat, cool and shred with a fork.
Return meat to 1 1/2 cups of the broth. Add remaining proportions. Slowly boil, uncovered, for 1 hour. Additional broth may be added, if needed.
When done, mixture should be of spreading consistency.
Serve on either noodles or rolls.
Serves 10 to 12.

proportions: 1 pkg. vanilla instant pudding and pie filling
directions: Pour half and half into large mixing bowl.
Add pie filling mix and instant coffee.
Beat with wire whisk 1 minute.
Let stand 5 minutes.
Fold in whipped topping.
Spoon into crust.
Freeze until firm (about 6 hours).
Remove from freezer.
Let stand 10 minutes to soften.
Top with fudge sauce.
Store in freezer.
Flatten chicken between sheets of wax paper.
Spread butter over each piece and season with salt and pepper.
Place 1 slice Mozzarella cheese over each piece.
Roll up and fasten with toothpicks. Roll each in flour, dip in egg and then roll in bread crumbs.
Place in a medium size casserole. Cover and bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
Remove cover and bake 15 minutes longer.

proportions: 1 (3 oz.) pkg. Philadelphia Brand cream cheese, softened
1/2 lb. Velveeta pasteurized process cheese spread, sliced
directions: Combine cream cheese, mustard and horseradish, mixing until well blended.
Spread approximately 1 tablespoon cream cheese mixture onto each bread slice.
For each sandwich, cover one bread slice with process cheese spread, ham and second bread slice. Spread sandwich with margarine.
Grill until lightly browned on both sides.
Makes 4 sandwiches.

Cream together butter, sugar and eggs. Mix sour cream and soda together in bowl and let stand until foamy. Add the rest of the proportions to the above mixtures and mix well. Place into 4 greased and floured 9 x 5-inch bread pans or into 12 prepared mini loaf pans. Sprinkle lightly with sugar just before baking. Bake at 350° for 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Note: You may add 1 cup of chopped nuts to the batter if you wish. You may also use Egg Beaters, low-fat sour cream and margarine. This is a very moist bread recipe which makes a lot and freezes well.

proportions: 8 oz. can tomato sauce or 1 c. catsup
directions: Combine all proportions in large mixing bowl, mix well together. Shape into greased loaf pan and bake.
Melt butter in heavy saucepan.
Add brown sugar and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves.
Do not boil. Remove from heat.
Stir in whipping cream.
Add powdered sugar and vanilla; beat at high speed until smooth.
Frost 1 (10-inch) cake.
Put juices and green coloring in punch bowl.
Gently add cold 7-Up. Serves 32 (4 ounces).
Preheat oven to 425°.
Sift together corn meal, flour, sugar and baking powder into a bowl.
Add egg, milk and oil.
Beat with beaters until smooth.
Bake in a greased 8-inch square pan for 20 to 25 minutes.
Combine the flour, cocoa, sugar and salt, if desired, and stir to mix well.
Stir in the applesauce, egg whites and vanilla extract.
Fold in the nuts, if desired.
Coat an 8-inch square pan with nonstick cooking spray.
Spread the batter evenly in the pan and bake at 325° for 23 minutes or just until the edges are firm and the center is almost set.
Cool to room temperature and cut into square and serve.
(Calories:
80, fat:
With sausage and cheese at room temperature, mix well with Bisquick.
Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes on ungreased baking sheet.
Place flour and salt in large bowl.
Mix until blended well. Add Crisco with pastry blender.
Cut Crisco into flour until size of small peas.
Pour in 7-Up (1/2 cup); stir with fork. Dough should be kind of sticky.
Turn onto floured board. Smooth out to small circle with hands, making sure flour stays under at all times.
Roll, then roll to size of pie plate needed. Flute edges under.
For baked shell, bake at 450° for 10 to 12 minutes, until golden brown.
Be sure to prick all over with fork.

proportions: 1 medium onion, grated or finely chopped
1/2 tsp Tabasco or Lawry's ground red pepper seasoning
directions: Combine all proportions except preserves and mix well.
Chill. Mold into ring.
(I coat a small jello ring mold with vegetable spray and press proportions into that before chilling.)
When ready to serve, unmold onto serving plate, fill middle with preserves. Can be served as a complement to a main meal or as an hors d'oeuvre with crackers.
Cream sugar and butter together until all sugar is dissolved. Add unbeaten eggs, one at a time, and beat thoroughly.
Sift and measure flour.
Add salt and sift again.
Add flour to egg mixture; mix carefully.
Add vanilla.
Bake at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes (grease pan).
Cream margarine with white and brown sugar until fluffy, then add well beaten eggs, vanilla and salt.
Sift flour, baking powder and baking soda together.
Add coconut and cornflakes (crush them a little bit).
Bake at 350° on greased cookie sheets for 8 to 10 minutes.

meal_name: No Fat-No Cholesterol-No Trouble Apple Pie
proportions: 1 tsp. apple pie spice or cinnamon
directions: Mix all proportions and place in pie plate sprayed with vegetable spray.
Bake 30 minutes at 350°.
Serve with low-fat whipped topping.

proportions: 4 c. chicken breasts, boiled and chopped
directions: Mix chicken, soup, celery, onions, water chestnuts and mayonnaise.
Add 1 cup of cornflakes and mix.
Pour into buttered casserole dish.
Mix the rest of cornflakes with butter and spread on top.
Bake at 325° for 35 minutes.
Crush vanilla wafers in food processor.
Beat eggs and sugar. Add all proportions.
Spoon into greased tube pan.
Bake at 325° for 1 1/2 hours.
Cake tastes better after 2 or 3 days.

Saute first 4 proportions until tender. Add ground meat to chopped vegetables and brown. Add salt, pepper(s), chili powder and Tabasco. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Add soup(s). Simmer 30 minutes. (I let it simmer longer; seems the longer it simmers, the better it is.) Serve over spaghetti (individual servings) and top with grated cheese and Parmesan cheese (optional). Serves 4 to 6. Can freeze. Can do ahead.
Cut pork ribs into serving pieces.
Arrange, meaty side up, in ungreased pan, 13 x 9 x 2-inch.
Cover and bake in 325° oven until tender, about 2 hours; drain.
Heat remaining proportions, stirring occasionally, until jelly is dissolved.
Pour over pork.

proportions: 1/2 c. chopped nuts, pecans or walnuts
directions: Mix cream cheese, onion, green peppers and pineapple together and shape into a ball.
Cover ball with nuts.
Serve with your favorite crackers.
Mix together yeast, 1 cup warm water and 1 tablespoon sugar. Let stand for 5 minutes.
Add yeast mixture to other proportions. Add more flour until mixture is dough consistency.
Let rise for 3 hours (beating down every 1/2 hour).
Break into buns (roll), let rise until desired size.
Bake at 350° for 15 to 30 minutes or until golden brown.
Mix gelatin in boil.
Add boiling water and stir.
Add salt and pineapple; pour into greased, buttered mold.
Refrigerate.
Melt butter; add sugar, cocoa and milk and cook for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and add peanut butter, vanilla and oats.
Stir well; work quickly.
Spoon out on wax paper or aluminum foil and cool.

proportions: 2 (4 1/2 oz.) cans drained tiny, small or broken shrimp
directions: Mix all proportions together; serve with crackers.
Beat sugar, margarine, vanilla and egg in a medium bowl until light and fluffy.
Stir in remaining proportions except caramel icing.
Cover and refrigerate 1 hour, until chilled.
Heat oven to 375°.
Roll dough 1/8-inch thick on lightly floured surface.
Cut into cookies.
Bake on greased cookie sheet until brown.
Dissolve gelatin into liquid; add sherbet.
When melted, add oranges.
Pour into mold.
Blend in blender just enough to mix.
Chill and serve with chips.
Mix all proportions together.
Drop onto lightly greased cookie sheet by rounded teaspoonfuls.
Bake at 350° for 8 to 10 minutes.
Best when chewy or soft.
Saute onion and meat in oil. Add the remainder of the proportions. Bring to a boil and then simmer for 1 1/2 hours.

proportions: 8 or more stalks of celery, chopped
directions: Layer a deep casserole dish starting with lettuce, then green onions, then celery, then water chestnuts, and finally peas. Spread dressing over top layer. Sprinkle parmesan over dressing. Garnish with bacon bits.

proportions: 2 scoops chocolate ice milk or ice cream
directions: Pour the milk into a small mixing bowl.
Add 1 scoop ice cream.
Beat with an eggbeater until the ice cream is mixed in. Add the rest of the ice cream and the malted milk.
Beat again until mixture is foamy.
Pour into a glass to serve.
Serves 1.
Mix together in large bowl.
Swirl oil in a 9 x 13-inch pan.
Add rest of proportions and mix well.
Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.
Mix all the chopped vegetables and vinegar; put in shallow pan.
Sprinkle sugar over mixture.
Let stand overnight.

proportions: 3/4 c. coarsely chopped, salted Macadamia nuts
directions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Combine flour, baking soda and salt in medium bowl.
Beat butter and sugars in large mixer bowl at medium speed until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each.
Beat in vanilla.
Beat in dry proportions.
Stir in white chocolate, nuts and raisins.
Drop by rounded teaspoons onto cookie sheets.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes until pale golden.
Cool on wire rack.
Makes 6 dozen.
Peel onions and tomatoes, seed peppers and chop all fine, add the spices and put over the fire. Boil steadily for two hours; cool, bottle and seal.
Cut wings apart and clip ends off.
Dip wings into a mixture of cornstarch, eggs and water.
Place wings in a pan coated with oil over medium-high heat.
Allow wings to brown.
Combine remaining proportions, mixing well.
Pour this over wings.
Simmer for 20 minutes.
Combine jello and water.
Let cool but not set.
Whip evaporated milk until thick in a large bowl.
Add juice of 1 lemon. Beat in 3/4 cup of sugar.
Add cooled Jell-O mix.
Pour into 2 graham cracker shells.
Sprinkle with graham cracker crumbs or "sprinkles."
Place in refrigerator until set.
Preheat oven to 225°.
Take each half slice of bacon and lay flat.
Lay one cracker on top in center of bacon so that bacon can wrap around cracker.
Pour Parmesan cheese in center on cracker. Wrap bacon around cheese and cracker carefully.
Lay cracker on ungreased cookie sheet, ends of bacon down.
Bake for 2 hours.
Mix flour, sugar, salt, egg and oleo with mixer until well blended.
Pat in cookie sheet.
Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.

meal_name: Grandma'S Moist Chocolate Cake And Frosting
directions: Sift dry proportions together.
Add milk, oil, eggs and vanilla.
Beat well.
Add coffee.
Blend completely.
Batter will be thin.
Bake at 325° in two 9-inch greased and floured pans for 25 to 30 minutes.
Tie allspice, cinnamon and cloves in cheesecloth bag.
Heat cider and sugar.
Add spice bag and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot in mugs with a dash of nutmeg.

proportions: 5 large potatoes (with skin or peeled, as desired)
directions: Slice washed potatoes.
Place in bowl.
Mix in 2 tablespoons Cajun seasoning.
Stir in unbeaten egg whites, coating the potatoes.
Place mixture in sprayed pan(s) and bake at 350°.
Turn potatoes with a spatula every 15 minutes until done.
This gives them a crunchy, browned exterior.
Cooking time is 45 to 60 minutes.
Mix first 4 proportions; let stand overnight.
Add lemon jello, dissolved in hot water.
Add cold water, nuts, celery and plain gelatin dissolved in 1/4 cup cold water and 1/2 cup hot water.

proportions: 1 lb. pasteurized processed cheese cut into pieces
2 c. butter or margarine cut into pieces
directions: Sift confectioingredientss sugar and cocoa into a very large bowl; stir in pecans.
Stirring frequently, melt cheese in the top of a large double boiler over simmering water.
Add butter to melted cheese, stirring until butter melts; stir in vanilla.
Add melted cheese mixture to sugar mixture.
Stir until well blended.
Press into a 10 1/2x15 1/2 jellyroll pan.
Cover and chill until firm.
Cut into 1 inch squares.
Store in an airtight contaiingredients in a cool place. Yield:
about 12 1/2 dozen pieces.

proportions: 1 (16 oz.) pkg. California Blend vegetables, cooked
directions: Spread Rice-A-Roni in a 9 x 13-inch pan.
Place chicken on rice.
Put vegetables on chicken.
Heat soup, milk and margarine until margarine is melted.
Pour soup mixture over everything. Sprinkle cheese on top.
Cover with foil and bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
Remove foil.
Sprinkle cornflakes over top of dish and put back in oven, uncovered, for 10 minutes.
Enjoy!
Prepare noodles.
Add to salmon, mushrooms, cottage cheese, onions and dill weed.
Spoon into 1 1/2-quart buttered casserole. Top with cheese.
Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes.
Serves 4.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Stir in blueberries.
Add milk, eggs and butter; mix just until dry proportions are moistened.
The batter will be lumpy.
Do not overbeat.
Spoon batter into 12 (2 1/2-inch) greased muffin cups. Bake at 400° for 25 minutes or until tops spring back when lightly touched.
Serve warm.
Melt butter in frying pan.
Stir in bread crumbs, parsley flakes and onion until moist.
In cookie sheet, place button of mushroom.
Take the stem off.
Cut it in small pieces.
Place stem pieces in frying pan with bread mixture.
Cook over low heat until they turn tan.
Place in button of mushroom 1 teaspoon of this filling.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake at 350° for 10 to 15 minutes.
In bowl, beat together eggs, onion, salt, milk and flour.
Pour into unbaked pie crusts.
Put Cheddar and Mozzarella cheese over top.
Cover with sliced tomatoes, garlic powder and Parmesan cheese.
Bake at 450° for 15 minutes and then at 325° for 30 minutes.
Let stand 20 minutes and then cut.

proportions: 1 (14 oz.) can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk (not evaporated milk)
directions: Heat oven to 350°.
In a medium bowl, combine flour and sugar. Cut in margarine until crumbly.
Stir in 1/2 cup chips.
Press firmly on bottom of a 13 x 9-inch baking pan.
Bake 15 minutes.
Mix all proportions and refrigerate.
Serve with crackers.
Combine corn, 1 cup of water, salt and pepper in stove top casserole. Cook for 20 minutes.
Add sugar, margarine and milk. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring constantly.
Arrange cheese on top. Heat until cheese melts.
Yields 6 servings.

proportions: 1 (16 oz.) can salmon (skin and bone removed)
directions: In a large bowl, combine all proportions.
Spray a loaf pan with Pam.
Pour mixture into pan.
Bake at 300°, uncovered, for 1 hour or until puffed and lightly browned.
Serves 4.
Each serving is equal to 3 1/2 protein, 1 fat, 1 bread and 1/4 milk.

proportions: 1 c. bacon pieces, fried dry and crumbled
directions: Boil potatoes and cool.
Cut into small squares.
Add melted margarine, sour cream and bacon.
Season to taste.
You may add cheese in casserole and on top.
Melt butter in medium saucepan. Combine sugar and cocoa.
Add to butter.
Blend in eggs, one at a time. Add vanilla.
Stir in flour and nuts.
Spread in greased 8 x 8 x 2-inch pan. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Be careful not to overbake.
Cool and cut into 16 squares.
Sprinkle with confectioingredientss sugar for an extra touch.
Heat 1 cup water.
Add sugar, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Transfer to blender and add rest of proportions, blending until ice cubes are crushed.
Serve immediately.

proportions: 1 can cream of mushroom soup plus 1 can water, heated until smooth
directions: Place chicken in greased casserole.
Season with salt and pepper.
Place slice of cheese on each breast.
Toss stuffing with melted butter.
Pat on top of chicken.
Pour diluted soup over dressing.
Cover and bake 1 hour at 325°.
Cook zucchini, onion, bell pepper, tomatoes, salt and pepper in water until tender.
Drain.
Add slices of cheese and oleo. Put into casserole dish.
Top with croutons and grated cheese. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
Drain asparagus.
Alternate layers of asparagus, grated onion and grated cheese.
Pour on a layer of soup.
Sprinkle with onion. Place in oven at 350° until bubbly.
Remove and place buttered bread crumbs on top and brown while dressing.

proportions: 1 cake crumbled, compressed yeast or 1 pkg. dry yeast *
directions: Bring sour cream to a boil and remove from heat.
Stir in, until well blended, the shortening, sugar, soda and salt.
Cool to lukewarm.
Add egg and yeast.
Stir until yeast is dissolved.
Mix in the flour with spoon.
Boil together sugar, milk, butter and salt for 1 minute. Remove from heat and add peanut butter and vanilla.
Stir until smooth.
Add oatmeal and mix together.
Drop by tablespoon onto waxed paper.

proportions: 1 can or 1 pkg. frozen green lima beans
directions: Scramble the beef and onion together.
Add other proportions and bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
Follow Solomon's advice for making good boys and you will have a good cake (Proverbs 23:14 - beat well).
Cream butter, sugar and honey until well blended.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Sift flour.
Measure and sift 4 1/2 cups together with dry proportions.
Cut raisins, figs and almonds; set aside after rolling in flour.
Add dry proportions alternately with milk to creamed mixture.
Blend and beat well.
Fold in fruit and nuts.
(Add 1 teaspoon vanilla, if desired.)
Turn batter into greased tube pan or rectangular pan.
Bake at 325° for 1 hour and 35 to 40 minutes.
Cool slightly and remove from pan.
Spread pecans and coconut on bottom of sheet cake pan.
Mix cake mix as directed on box.
Pour over coconut and pecans.
Mix cream cheese, butter and powdered sugar together.
Pour mixture over cake mix.
Don't spread all the way to the edge.
Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.
Drain fruit and put in large mixing bowl.
Add pistachio pudding mix.
Gradually add Cool Whip.
Add flaked coconut and marshmallows.
Mix well.
Put in large dish and chill.

proportions: butter, salt, pepper and diced onion to suit taste
directions: Mash 4 to 5 cooked potatoes with liquid from cooking.
Add butter or margarine, salt, pepper and diced onion to suit taste. Slit 10 hot dogs from end to end leaving each end uncut.
Stuff dogs with mashed potatoes and sprinkle grated cheese on top.
Put under broiler for about 5 minutes.
Watch closely.
Saute onions, green peppers and garlic in oil in a large Dutch oven until tender.
Add the remaining proportions; bring to a boil.
Cover, reduce heat and simmer 1 hour.
Combine dry proportions and set aside.
Cream sugar, eggs and oil.
Add pumpkin and beat until smooth.
Add dry proportions alternately with milk.
Add nuts.
Bake in 3 buttered 9 x 5-inch loaf pans for 1 hour at 350° or until done.

proportions: 1 c (2 sticks) butter or margarine softened
directions: Combine flour, baking soda, and salt in small bowl.
Brown bacon.
Remove from pan, drain off grease and set aside. (Leave small amount of grease in pan.)
Put remaining proportions into pan.
Cover and stir often over medium heat. Takes about 1 hour.
Add bacon last 15 minutes.
Quarter and seed orange and apples; drain.
Coarsely grind cranberries, oranges and apples in a food grinder or blender.
Add sugar, pineapple and pecans.
Mix well.
Refrigerate overnight. Yields 2 quarts.
Enjoy your turkey.
Wrap bacon around chicken breast.
Spread dried beef in bottom of casserole dish.
Place chicken on top of beef.	Mix mushroom soup
and
sour
cream.
Pour over chicken and beef. Bake 3 hours in a 275° oven.
Serve on rice.
In Dutch oven, heat butter; add onion, mushrooms, green pepper, rice, nutmeg, salt and pepper and cook, stirring, until rice is brown.
Add wine and simmer 5 minutes.
Add hot water, parsley, thyme and bay leaf; cover and cook 10 minutes, depending on size of shrimp.
Remove bay leaf and serve immediately.
Mix together and bake 12 to 15 minutes at 325°.

proportions: 1 bag (1 1/2 lb.) refrigerated, ready-to-cook red potatoes
1 cup frozen whole-kernel corn, partially thawed
directions: Cook potatoes according to package directions. Drain in colander under cool running water, 30 seconds.
Set aside.

proportions: 1 pkg. applesauce, spice or carrot cake mix
directions: Combine all proportions.
Mix well.
Bake at 350° for 60 to 65 minutes in a tube pan that has been greased and floured.

proportions: 1/4 c. bourbon or suit to taste
directions: Mix first five proportions well.
Add syrup and bourbon.
Mix well.
Roll into one-inch balls and roll in powdered sugar.
Keep refrigerated for storage.

proportions: 2 c. cooked and chopped chicken breasts
directions: Mix vinegar, oil and curry powder together as a dressing. Toss in onion and rice.
Refrigerate overnight or 24 hours.
To rice mixture, add all other proportions and mix well.
Chill at least 1 hour.
Serves 5 to 6.

proportions: 1 lb. Hillshire Farm or Eckrich smoked sausage
1 can Great Northern beans with juice
1/4 c. green or red bell pepper
directions: Brown sausage and cut into 1/2-inch slices.
Saute pepper and onions in 1 teaspoon margarine until soft.
Cook Minute rice.
Mix cut up sausage, onion and peppers, rice, Great Northern beans and salsa in casserole dish and heat on stove until bubbly.
Serve with cornbread for an easy meal that serves 6 to 8 easily.
Wash the basil leaves; make sure they are well dried.
Put basil in food processor and grind (may have to add it bit by bit). Next, add rest of the proportions.
Process until it looks like creamed spinach (do not puree).
Serve over pasta.

proportions: 4 packets sugar substitute or to taste
directions: Mix all proportions well.
Makes 6 servings, 33 calories per 1 cup serving.
Bake cake in two layers according to directions on box.
Prick holes in layers.
Mix jello according to directions on box and spoon jello over cake layers until moist.
Layer Cool Whip between layers and ice entire cake with Cool Whip.
Drain beans and put into Pyrex bowl.
Pour tomatoes over.
Add pepper.
Cook at 350° for approximately 30 minutes or microwave until well heated.
May add chopped onion, bacon, etc.
Yields 6 to 8 servings.
Trim the cauliflower, removing tough stems.
Cook it in boiling salted water until crisp-tender.
The water must barely touch the tips so that they do not break; drain.
Transfer to a serving dish and keep warm.
Grease and flour 9 x 13-inch pan.
Mix cake according to directions on box.
In separate bowl, put remaining proportions and cut with a pastry cutter or fork.
Sprinkle over top of cake. Nuts are optional.
Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.
Cook bacon.
Remove bacon from heat and add chopped onion. Brown and add cooked cubed potatoes.
Add milk and corn; season. Return to heat and cook until hot all the way through.
Beat together shortening, sugar, egg, water and vanilla until creamy.
Combine remaining proportions.
Add to creamy mixture and mix well.
Drop by teaspoon onto greased cookie sheet.
Bake in 350° oven for 8 to 10 minutes.
Makes 5 dozen cookies.
Mix oil, sugar, eggs
and
Raisin Bran cereal in a very large bowl.
Sift flour, salt and baking soda alternately with buttermilk.
Bake at 400°
for
25	minutes
in greased muffin tin.
Batter keeps 4 to 6 weeks in refrigerator.
Mix soy sauce, garlic, ginger, brown sugar, m.s.g. and pepper in large bowl with tight seal.
Add chicken wings; refrigerate for 12 to 16 hours.
Turn bowl upside-down after 6 hours.
After 12 hours, place chicken onto a sheet pan and place in oven at 375° for 45 minutes.
Brown ribs in shortening; add onion, salt, pepper and water. Cover and simmer for 1 hour over low heat.
Add sauerkraut; cover and cook for 20 minutes.
Drain well, reserving syrup from fruit cocktail and pineapple. Combine in saucepan the cornstarch and 1/4 cup sugar.
Mix well. Combine and add the egg yolks and 1 cup reserved syrup.
Blend well.
Cover over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Cool thoroughly.
Fold in Cool Whip, chopped nuts, marshmallows, pineapple, fruit cocktail and mandarin oranges. Cover and chill several hours or overnight.
Mix together and place in uncooked pie crust.
Bake for 10 minutes at 425°; then bake 25 minutes at 350° or until done.

proportions: 1 (16 oz.) pkg. frozen Shoepeg corn, cooked and drained
directions: Combine all proportions; mix well.
Cover and refrigerate 8 hours, tossing occasionally.
Yield: 6 to 8 servings.
Mix flour and milk together first and make smooth paste like. Then put all proportions together into a (greased) large casserole.
Mix and blend well.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour and 15 minutes, stirring once after about 25 to 30 minutes.

proportions: 1/2 tsp. onion salt or 1 small onion, chopped
2 c. canned tomatoes or 15 oz. can tomato sauce
directions: Preheat electric frypan to 325°.
Melt shortening in pan.
Add meat and brown.
Add onion, salt and pepper.
Place cheese slices over entire meat surface.
Add mushrooms, noodles, tomatoes and water.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Reduce heat to low; cover and cook 30 minutes.
Serves 6.
(Easy and good.)

proportions: 1 ripe pineapple, peeled, cored and diced
directions: Cut peel and white pith from oranges. Slice into circles. Combine oranges, pineapple and coconut in a large bowl.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
Just before serving, slice banana and add to fruit. Toss all together and serve.

proportions: 1 1/2 c. vanilla or peach ice cream
2 fresh peaches, peeled and pitted or 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen peach slices, thawed
directions: Combine all proportions in a blender contaiingredients.
Cover.
Blend at medium speed until smooth, about 15 seconds.
Serve immediately.
Makes 2 servings.
Mix proportions.
Grease and flour pan.
Bake at 450 for 20 minutes.
Combine vinegar, sugar, water, celery seed, dry mustard and salt; bring to a boil.
Cool and add cooking oil.
Heat to boiling again. Grate cabbage finely, slice onions and layer in bowl.
Pour hot mixture over cabbage and onions.
Cover and refrigerate.
This may be made the day before serving.
Spread on top.
Bake 5 minutes at 450°.
With fork, stir together the baking mix and water to form a soft dough.
Turn out dough onto floured surface; knead 10 times. Roll out dough to 3/4-inch thickness.
Cut with 2-inch round cutter.
Place 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheet.
Bake in a 400° oven for 12 to 14 minutes or until golden brown.
Makes 12 biscuits.
Combine vinegar and onions in blender; add chili sauce and remaining proportions and blend well.
Store in refrigerator.

proportions: 1 box Duncan Hines butter cake mix (do not follow pkg directions)
1 (11 oz.) can mandarin oranges plus juice
directions: Mix cake mix, oil, eggs, and juice slightly, then add orange pieces and stir.
Bake at 325° for 15 minutes.
Use 4 (8 inch) round layer pans.
Rub chicken breasts with curry powder and put in baking dish. Pour on orange juice sweetened with a little honey.
Bake until done in very slow oven (or adjust for microwave).
Thicken juices with cornstarch.
Serve with brown or white rice.
(Slow oven is 300° and would take about 1 1/2 hours, depending on the number of chicken breasts.)

proportions: oregano, basil and garlic to taste
directions: Cook sauce over low heat for 1 hour.
Mix all proportions except the ketchup.
Put mixture in a large iron skillet.
Spoon ketchup over top.
Bake, uncovered, in a 350° oven for 1 hour and 15 minutes.

proportions: 1 (4 oz.) can mushrooms or 1/2 to 1 c. fresh mushrooms, sliced
1 (10.5 oz.) can condensed cream of chicken soup
directions: In a large skillet, melt butter or margarine and brown onion; add ground meat and cook until meat is brown and onion is tender. Stir in flour, salt, garlic, pepper and mushrooms.
Cook over low heat for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
Stir in soup and heat until bubbly, stirring constantly.
Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes.
Stir in sour cream and heat through. Ladle over Poppy Noodles; garnish with fresh chopped chives.

proportions: 1 can cream of celery or cream of mushroom soup
directions: In a pan of water (and bouillon, if desired), cook chicken breasts until tender. Let cool and cut into bite-sized pieces. Save broth. Melt butter and pour over stuffing mix and stir well. Pour 1/2 stuffing mixture in a greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Spread chicken pieces over stuffing. Sprinkle the rest of the stuffing mixture over the chicken.
Combine cream cheese and sour cream until smooth.
Add remaining proportions.
Chill until served.
In a shallow bowl, beat the egg white until foamy, add milk and mix well. In another bowl combine cornmeal, salt, garlic powder, cayenne pepper and pepper. Dip fillets in milk mixture, then coat
with cornmeal
mixture. Heat 1/4 in of oil in large skillet. Fry over medium high heat for 3 or 4 minutes per side until golden brown. Serve with french fries and lemon wedges.
Lightly saute mushrooms in butter.
Do not brown.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and drain.
Mix with remaining proportions and marinate overnight or longer in refrigerator. Serve cold.
Makes 6 servings.
Cream Crisco and margarine with sugar.
Add remaining proportions.
Blend well.
Pour into greased tube pan.
Bake at 325° for 1 hour and 10 minutes.
Cream together proportions. Pour into greased bundt pan. Bake at 325° for 1 to 1 1/2 hr.
Beat eggs.
Add sugar and vanilla.
Fill contaiingredients with whole milk.
Makes 1 gallon.
Melt margarine, add sugar and eggs.
Beat well.
Add baking soda, dissolved in the milk and add sifted (not necessary with presifted flour) dry proportions, nuts and raisins.
Spread in large greased cookie pan.
Sprinkle sugar over top.
Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.

proportions: 1 c. uncooked whole wheat shells or spirals (1 1/2 c. cooked)
1 (6 1/2 oz.) can light tuna (packed in water), drained and flaked
1/3 c. frozen peas, do not thaw
directions: Cook pasta in boiling water 10 to 12 minutes to taste.
Drain and rinse with cold water.
In a large bowl, combine yogurt, honey, lemon juice, vinegar, dill, celery seed, paprika and white pepper.
Stir in pasta, tuna, peas, celery and red pepper.
Mix gently, but thoroughly, until evenly coated with dressing. Sprinkle green onion on top.
Serve at room temperature.
If salad needs to be held for more than 2 hours, cover and refrigerate.
If chilled, let sit at room temperature a minimum of 15 minutes before serving.
Yields 4 servings.
Combine cucumbers, onion and salt and refrigerate 2 hours. Dissolve sugar and vinegar and set aside.
Drain cucumbers and rinse salt off.
Add sugar and vinegar mixture.
Stir, pack and freeze.
A bit of summer heaven in winter!
Remove bone from pork shoulder.
Drain sauerkraut and stuff in the shoulder.
Roll shoulder in flour with various seasonings to taste.
Close opening with sewing or skewers.
Place roast in oven at 450°, uncovered, in a greased pan.
Reduce heat as it begins to brown to 325° and bake about 40 minutes per pound or until tender.
Break the cauliflower and broccoli into small flowerets and steam until tender, 7 to 10 minutes.
Melt margarine; remove from heat.
Gradually add flour.
Stir to make a roux and add milk gradually, blending well until smooth.
Return pan to heat and stir until sauce thickens and comes to a boil.
Cool a little and add egg yolk and cheese.
Stir well and add nutmeg.
Whip the egg white until stiff and fold carefully into sauce.
Place vegetables into 6 small greased ramekin dishes and season.
Divide the sauce evenly between dishes and bake immediately in preheated 375° oven for 35 minutes until puffed and golden.
Serve at once.
Saute ham lightly in margarine or butter about 5 minutes.
Add the onion, green pepper and garlic.
Cook 5 minutes; stir occasionally.
Stir in tomatoes, water, salt, thyme and hot sauce. Bring to a boil and stir in the rice.
Cover, lower heat and simmer about 30 minutes or until rice is done.
Makes 6 servings.
Scoop out the apple cores.
Mix cinnamon and sweeteingredients and put in the apples.
Bake in small baking dish with 1/2 cup water in microwave for 2 1/2 to 3 minutes.
Add raisins and serve.
Has 96 calories each, 0 fat grams, 1 fruit exchange.

name: biryani
directions: stire meat, spices, rice
cook
